intro: Neuberia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved neuberia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Neuberia longifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
